content.headline: Your Complete Guide to Safe Pregnancy Fitness
content.intro: Exercise during pregnancy is generally safe and beneficial, but understanding the specific guidelines for each trimester ensures you and your baby stay healthy. This comprehensive guide covers approved activities, safety precautions, and trimester-specific recommendations.

sections.title: Recommended Exercises by Trimester
sections.content: Adjust your routine as your pregnancy progresses:
points: First trimester: Continue most pre-pregnancy activities with medical clearance
Second trimester: Focus on posture and balance as center of gravity shifts
Third trimester: Emphasize comfort and preparation for labor
Throughout: Walking, swimming, stationary cycling are consistently safe
Avoid: Contact sports, activities with falling risk, hot yoga, scuba diving

sections.title: Warning Signs to Stop Exercising
sections.content: Immediately cease activity and contact your provider if you experience:
points: Chest pain or difficulty breathing before exertion
Calf pain or swelling (possible blood clot)

sections.title: Trimester-Specific Modifications
points: Weeks 1-13: Manage fatigue, stay hydrated, avoid overheating
Weeks 14-27: Modify balance exercises, support growing belly
Weeks 28-40: Focus on pelvic exercises, reduce intensity as needed
Always: Warm up gradually and cool down properly
Monitor: Heart rate should allow conversation during exercise
Adapt: Listen to your body's changing needs daily
